alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Wayne, southwestern Bell, southwestern Knox, southeastern Pulaski, McCreary and Whitley Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 815 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Boone Heights to Walden to near Alpine. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Goldbug, Clio, Wofford and Perkins around 820 PM EDT. Williamsburg, Greenwood, Krupp, Suttons Mill, Yaden, Honeybee and Julip around 825 PM EDT. Parkers Lake, Redbird and Ingram around 830 PM EDT. Wiborg, Bon, Bounty, Beulah Heights, Emlyn, Duckrun and Pleasant View around 835 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
